citation.article-title: Thalassobacillus cyri sp. nov., a moderately halophilic Gram-positive bacterium from a hypersaline lake
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Thalassobacillus cyri sp. nov.
Thalassobacillus cyri (cy′ri. L. masc. gen. n. cyri of Cyrus, named after Cyrus, the first king of Persia, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-positive, motile, endospore-forming rods, 0.6–0.8×1.3–8.5 μm in size.
Ellipsoidal endospores are produced at a central-subterminal position in swollen sporangia.
Colonies are circular, entire, smooth, cream–beige and are 2 mm in diameter on 10 % HM agar medium after 48 h incubation at 37 °C.
Strictly aerobic.
Moderately halophilic, growing at 1–15 % (w/v) NaCl, with optimal growth at 8 % (w/v) NaCl.
No growth occurs in the absence of NaCl.
Grows at 5–45 °C (optimally at 40 °C) and at pH 7.0–9.5 (optimally at pH 7.5).
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Casein, starch, DNA, aesculin and Tween 80 are hydrolysed but gelatin is not hydrolysed.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite but nitrite is not reduced.
Acid is produced from d-fructose, d-glucose, galactose, d-mannose, maltose, melibiose and trehalose but not from myo-inositol, lactose or d-xylose.
Methyl red test is positive and lysine decarboxylase and arginine dihydrolase activities are positive.
Indole or H2S are not produced.
Voges–Proskauer, urease, β-galactosidase, ornithine decarboxylase and phenylalanine deaminase tests are negative.

The following compounds are utilized as sole source of carbon and energy: d-fructose, galactose, lactose, maltose, d-mannose, melibiose, d-ribose, sucrose, glycerol, alanine, arginine, asparagine, cysteine, leucine and proline.
The following compounds are not utilized as sole source of carbon and energy: d-glucose, myo-inositol, glycine, lysine, methionine and valine.
Sensitive to amoxicillin (30 μg), carbenicillin (100 μg), gentamicin (30 μg), nitrofurantoin (300 μg), tetracycline (30 μg), rifampicin (5 μg) and polymixin B (100 U).
Resistant to tobramycin (10 μg) and kanamycin (30 μg).
Polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, two phospholipids and a glycolipid.
The isoprenoid quinone is MK-7.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan type is A1γ, with meso-diaminopimelic acid as the diagnostic diamino acid.
The major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, iso-C14 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0 and iso-C15 : 0.
The type strain, HS286T (=CCM 7597T=JCM 15722T), was isolated from the Howz-Soltan hypersaline lake in Iran.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 43.0 mol% (Tm).
